website_summaries.verdict: A simple shotgun case that comes at a good price.
pros: Fits firearms up to 33" in length
Includes two side pockets for holding shells
Sewn in elastic shotgun shell holders
Does not look like a gun case
cons: Does not have interior straps to hold your gun in place

customer_reviews.title: Fits well with side mounted accessories.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 42 inch, fits my Remington 870 Express 18" well WITH side saddle and side mounted Surefire light. Lots of room for it. Quality seems good.
customer_reviews.author: gotime242

customer_reviews.title: Great case for my Shockwave with added accessories of remote ...
customer_reviews.text: Great case for my Shockwave with added accessories of remote switched light, a crimson Trace laser, and sidesaddle shell carrier! Very well made with generous padding,and a quality zipper. Shell loops in pockets will hold 12 shells with plenty of room for other small items. Made in China, but could not find a USA made case that would work. Very happy with this purchase, and would not hesitate to order any Bulldog product in the future !!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Really nice case!
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned this would be a cheap, flimsy case, but it's padded with nice thick foam, the material looks to be nice & heavy, and the zippers feel sturdy. I read in another review that the two outer pockets hold a dozen shells, and not only so they but there are elastic shell holders in them to keep the shells upright! My mossberg persuader with a 20" barrel fits in this case perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry C

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shotgun bag.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a shotgun with folding stock or pistol grip. Seems well made and does exactly what It's supposed to do. The pouches on the outside are handy, as well. It holds my Remington 870 with Hogue pistol grip, perfectly! Also, plenty of room for my 56 shell bandolier. With my sling, bandolier and the outside pockets, that's 96 shells. There is one zipper, it feels pretty heavy it opens and closes easily. The outside shell pockets are held closed by Velcro and each has bands for 6 shells plus room for more. I really don't think you can beat it for the price and features.
customer_reviews.author: Kramer Junction

customer_reviews.title: Not just for shotguns.
customer_reviews.text: Good 42in. soft case for the price. There were a few hanging threads that needed trimming. Perfect fit for a Henry .22 rifle with 20 inch barrel. The overall rifle length is 38.5 inches. Each pocket can hold 3 of the plastic 100 count boxes easily.
customer_reviews.author: I am the Egg Man

customer_reviews.title: Well-built and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction, Nicely padded. Soft web handles on each side when opened. Two exterior pockets for holding shells or other supplies, such as energy bars or gloves. One of the review questions was "Easy to Lock?" It doesn't; there is a single zipper slide and no place to lock it. There's also a single ring on one end, but no matching one on the opposite end so using a shoulder strap won't work. My intended use was not for holding a shotgun anyway, but rather an Appalachian dulcimer, which it fits well at about half the cost of a somewhat similarly designed dulcimer case. People will think I'm an armed musician.
customer_reviews.author: L. Tate

customer_reviews.title: Buy this if
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Mossberg 590 The stitching and zipper feel solid, and yes its a little longer ( see pics ) but I also carry extras in the case so it ends up being a perfect fit. The two outside pockets are also generous in size and include 6 sewn in shell holders per pocket !!! Pros - Solid build, holds my 590 inside a tactical sheath, or .... - Securely holds up to 12 shells in two pockets. also enough room in those pockets to store extra shells or your lunch :) Cons - would be nice if they added a should strap other than that a perfect match.
customer_reviews.author: TruBlu

customer_reviews.title: No Shoulder Strap?
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with a very basic case, but for a reason I cannot discern there is a lone D-ring at one end and nothing at the opposite end. Were there one on each end, I could see how this would give a user the ability to affix a shoulder strap to this case, making it easier to carry. Maybe this was accidental, but I am not interested in a case that requires me to use only my hands to carry it. Unfortunately the seller did not include more photos other than the one listed on Amazon. A more robust view of the bag would have saved me and the shipper a lot of time. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: 33yamamoto

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality zipper, zero durability, don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag because of its compact design, to store my short barreled Benelli duty shotgun while I shopped for a heavier duty bag. The bulldog bag would not see heavy use or abuse since it would only be used to store my benelli in the back of my patrol vehicle. Unfortunately, the zipper on the bag failed the first week I was using it. It was probably only the 4th time I had opened the bag. I didn't expect a whole lot due to the low cost of the bag, but failing after a week is completely unacceptable. Don't order this product. Save your money and buy a quality bag that will last.
customer_reviews.author: SuperKenchan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product (Not Perfect, But Pretty Darn Close!)
customer_reviews.text: I have experience with both the 35" and 42" cases. They are well-made and a great value for the money. Be aware that the 35" case is a very tight 35" (meaning, if you are close to 35" with the item you want in this case, you may find yourself disappointed). But if you go in with eyes open, I don't think you can go wrong. If I could "wave my magi wand" for an instant improvement I would ask for dual zippers on the main compartment.
customer_reviews.author: X. Fossor

customer_reviews.title: A bargain for a simple case
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to replace a crumbling 90 year old double barrel shot gun case. I don't drive a Range Rover so I don't want a $200 hand stitched pretty English leather case. This case was perfect for my Grandfathers 12 gauge Browning baby. It's small and goes well with my Chevy Suburban too. Lol After all I actually use my toys, and maintain them. I'm not out to impress by leasing something overkill for ONLY $699.00 a month. Simple, practical affordable. Note it is one a single interior pocket. You will need additional padding like a couple of used heavy socks.
customer_reviews.author: JVH

customer_reviews.title: Mine wasn't 42"
customer_reviews.text: The case is nice but mine was not 42" long. The exterior measurements was barely 41", the interior about half inch shorter. If your shotgun is under 41", it should fit just fine. My Benelli SuperNova Tactical did not fit. Maybe I was just unlucky and received a defective case?
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of overall length of gun
customer_reviews.text: When I received the case I was surprised my tactical shotgun did not fit. I had not realized that the breacher attachment was not included in overall length stated by gun manufacturer. Actual overall length was a bit longer than the case. To send the case back was almost half the cost of the case. I positioned the gun in such a way that only about 1/2” of the breacher stuck out. I was then satisfied to keep the case as the quality and padding seemed very good and met my needs of safely transporting the gun to the range etc.
customer_reviews.author: John Neumann

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Case! Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome case! Perfect fit! This is a perfect case for my Keltec Sub2000 with a red dot on it and two mags! This is labeled as a "shotgun" case, but it works perfectly for my Keltec Sub2000. It has some good padding and nice handles and outside pockets. A great case for the money and suits my needs perfectly! I highly recommend this case!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: All 8 tubes fit well in the case and 1 set of end stands and the 2 J-hooks fit fairly good in each of the outer storage pockets
customer_reviews.text: I actually ordered this case to hold 2- 4pc sets of 37" aluminum tubes and 2 sets of the Pipe Target Hanging Hook Assembly's from High Caliber Targets. All 8 tubes fit well in the case and 1 set of end stands and the 2 J-hooks fit fairly good in each of the outer storage pockets, balancing out the package. It appears to be built fairly well and I'm sure it will last a long time bouncing around in the back of my 4X4.
customer_reviews.author: Woody's Customs

customer_reviews.title: Bad description, low quality zipper
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 42" case for my semi-auto shotgun that measures 40.75" at its longest point. It didn't fit. I measured the case and it was 41.5" long at its furthest outer dimension. I have no idea what the 42" description has to do with, but nothing on this case is 42" long. In addition, the zipper pulled and tugged right from the get go, felt very cheap. I have no doubt that if I'd kept it (it went right back in the box it came in), the zipper would have failed very quickly. AVOID!
customer_reviews.author: Always_Armed

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat this for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Maverick 88 special with the 20 inch barrel and this case was just the right fit. Any shorter and the gun wouldn't have fit then I would have had to return it. Other than that, this case is great!! I love the padding on the inside which makes you feel that your gun is protected. It also has 2 pockets on the side where you could either put a small gun in or ammo.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great case that fit my VR80 snugly
customer_reviews.text: Needed a soft case just for transportation purposes. Ordered this case and it came in pretty quick and seems sturdy. Fit my VR80 Shotgun snugly. The only thing that will be a problem is the width of the case. The hand grip barely fits even with the sights flipped down. When I get a new optic, it most likely will not fit. Still really like this case and is has great storage on the outside as well.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn W.

customer_reviews.title: 48 inches won't fit inside this
customer_reviews.text: This 48" case measures only 46.5" inside, so my 48" shotgun won't actually fit inside this 48" case without breaking the shotgun down. Still, it seems to be a really nice case, it's of a good quality, and I intend to use it in spite of its literal shortcomings . Perhaps my expectations for a 48" case were a little misguided.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: The 42” fits my Benelli M2 Tactical, with pistol grip, perfectly. It’s a great case for carrying in your vehicle, taking to the range, etc. It’s not a case to ship a weapon in, it’s designed for carrying and protecting a weapon. The shipper got it here early!
customer_reviews.author: M. J Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Works for more than shotguns
customer_reviews.text: Great case for Beretta CX-4. Shotshell loops can be alternately unstitched to hold magazines. Slick adaptation. Beats the hard case and carries six spare mags. Very durable and well made. Would be better if it had a second zipper pull, but that’s no deal- breaker.
customer_reviews.author: hb27

customer_reviews.title: Fit my large shotgun
customer_reviews.text: I have an AK style shotgun with external choke and muzzle break. This case is long enough to accommodate every thing fully assembled. I don't find the external pockets useful, they are just too small for my wants but that is a personal thing. Overall a nice case for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Stupid People are Annoying

customer_reviews.title: Can't complain for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Can't complain for the price. Sure, it's lacking many features of many more expensive cases, but as a basic soft gun case it'll do just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Damien S.

customer_reviews.title: Very well made!!
customer_reviews.text: This case is perfect for my 41 inch Mossberg 20 gauge shotgun. Well padded inside, 2 pockets have 6 slots for shells but you can add more loosely if you want to. Material very strong. I would buy again. Just don't go over 41 inches in total rifle length.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Good value Shotgun Case
customer_reviews.text: It's one of the few cases that holds a 46" shotgun easily without a gunsock sticking out of the end. Padding is light, but adequate. It does not come with a sling. The only downside is that the pockets aren't deep. You can't get a box of shells in the side pockets and we have to put our choke case inside the case instead of in the pockets. They seem to be water resistant, but not waterproof and definitely won't float. For the price, it's good for keeping your shotgun from being scratched up in the back of your vehicle or concealing what you're carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shotgun Case
customer_reviews.text: A perfect fit for a short-barreled shotgun. Gives you a nice pocket for shells or cleaning gear. Very portable and well-balanced. For me it's a great value for the money, exceeding the quality of some far more expensive cases.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Bunting

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a 48 inch case. The case arrived ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 48 inch case. The case arrived, the label indicates 48" but it actually measures 46.5 inches and my shotgun doesn't fit. When I pay for a product, I expect the dimensions to be accurate as advertised. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: David Patteron

customer_reviews.title: Very slim, not much will fit in here.
customer_reviews.text: The internal width of this case is very small. Almost nothing fits in here. The width of the case makes it sound big but because it is a thick taco style, you need it to be at least twice as wide as the stock. With this case that limits you to a working width of about 6 inches. Anything wider will not fit in this case.
customer_reviews.author: WildArmadillo

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the case
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the case! Well made, thick padding and fits the Mossberg 930 SPX perfectly. The shotgun us 39.5 inches long and the 42 inch case is perfect. There are two side pouches that close with hook and loop fasteners and have places for you to store ammunition should you choose to do that. Zipper is a high quality one but only a single one instead of two. Recommend the product but the only down side was how long it took to receive it. Three weeks!! That's why I only gave it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: This bag's length was a little over 2 inches shorter than advertised. Stitching is very shoddy, lots of loose strings in the bag. Didn't fit my 29" shotgun with an optic on it, bag doesn't even fit around it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great value! No complaints!
customer_reviews.text: Relatively cheap, simple design, and most importantly, it's held my shotgun perfectly! I bought another far more expensive case, but haven't used it because this one has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Falcon

customer_reviews.title: Great Case!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Remington 870 Tactical with an 18.5 inch barrel (38.5 in. total), and this bag fits it perfectly. It's made of heavy material, and sewn together very well. It unzips 3/4 of the way around and it can be padlocked when completely zipped up. It also has 2 deep outside pockets which each can hold 6 shells secured, and another whole box tossed in or any other gun range stuff you might want to throw in. I fully expect this bag to last many years. It's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: NightOwl57

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for a Mossburg 590 tactical shotgun with a pistol grip and adjustable stock. The 42 inch case fits the gun like a glove. The ballistic nylon and padding protects the shotgun from everyday bumps and is easy to carry to the range. The case has two velcro flapped side pockets that hold 6 shotgun shells in each. The shells are secured with elastic bands. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Scubadave

customer_reviews.title: A good value
customer_reviews.text: A very good value! I recently purchase my first shotgun, in fact my first firearm and this case does a great job of protecting this valuable weapon. I am certainly no expert in these matters but I think this is a really good value and expect this to serve its intended purpose for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Silver fox

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: good padding, solid zipper. Easy to lock is 3 stars because the loops to put your lock through is no aligned with the zipper when full closed. I should take a picture to demonstrate. But not a huge deal
customer_reviews.author: TeamAZ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shorter carry case for my Mossberg 590 Shockwave, and it fits perfectly, giving just a few inches of clearance needed, and the 2 large side pockets with built-in shell holders is a nice added touch. Very good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: .Needed an immediate case for my KSG
customer_reviews.text: I needed something quick and cheap for my KSG. It fit my shotgun just barely bare bones without sights. I later installed magpul flip up front and rear sights and now have a really tight fit. I kinda have to coax the zipper around th handle of the shotgun. So don't think about having any other sights staying on the top. There is still room leaving something installed on the bottom forend picatinny rail and if I install a muzzle and leave it on in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Msboobookitty

customer_reviews.title: Plush and thick.
customer_reviews.text: More spacious outside storage than expected. Would have liked double sided zipper. (Small change) Hanger loop makes closet swallow it nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Dannytheman

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done but get a size bigger
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 42" but it ended up being cut a little shorter than that, making my shotgun *barely* fit. However, it still fits so i can't complain much, and i like the outer side pockets to hold some shells.
customer_reviews.author: Tony K

customer_reviews.title: Good for RV'rs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this case to stow our E2 stabilizer bars and it works like a champ with no room to spare! Hopefully this will keep them from beating up the basement of our new trailer. There's room for the lift tool as well.
customer_reviews.author: Panda's Heart

customer_reviews.title: Nice Case For The Money
customer_reviews.text: Well its a big gun rug for your Remington or Mossberg 18" tactical shotgun. The ballistic nylon seems of good quality, big metal zippers, couple pouches on the front for shells, and a handle. A basic no frills rug thats well worth the price of admission. I also appreciate it being shipped in a long flat box instead of them folding it up and stuffing it in a small box thus creating creases in the case, good job Amazon 👍
customer_reviews.author: Christopher O. Strobel

customer_reviews.title: Simple and well built
customer_reviews.text: Love this case. I don't want you to think it's good to take in the back of your truck and get wet and beat up too much, but it's padded and holds 2 boxes of shells in the pockets provided on the outside. Sturdy zipper. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Basic...and of Very Good Materials...
customer_reviews.text: This case was a perfect fit for my Mossberg Tactical 20 gauge with pistol grip stock (38 1/2in L)... My guess is that if your shotgun has the taller "laser" sights, etc...it may not fit this case...so check the dimensions carefully. The zipper and material are both of very good quality. Padding is adequate and lots of velcro on the pockets which can accomodate shell strips or whatever... It's a very good product at the price point.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the price
customer_reviews.text: Holds a 12 gauge shotgun and has pockets for shells. Very protective and easy to carry/transport. Can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: John McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Great tactical case
customer_reviews.text: I used to own one of these before and really liked the way the case is. Not too expensive and like the look and the pockets on the side
customer_reviews.author: Big Eazy

customer_reviews.title: It's a decently built padded gun case for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I got the 42" case and I'm very happy. It's made of quality materials (a good zipper makes all the difference) and it's exactly the size it claims. I don't use mine for a shotgun, I use it for a scoped 10/22 with a muzzle device to stretches to just over 40 inches and fits snugly. The pouches on the exterior will hold small things that you're not too concerned about losing. But really, it's decently built padded gun case for the price.
customer_reviews.author: j_glaze

customer_reviews.title: Nice padding.
customer_reviews.text: Nice case for the money, a couple of pockets with loops to keep rounds in place. Great fit for an 18” barrel shotgun.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Pelletier

customer_reviews.title: Tactical shotgun case
customer_reviews.text: Great to hold the shotgun, when going to the range or hunting. Heavy enough to hold the shotgun but easy to carry and holds all the Accessories. Good buy all round good price and quality!
customer_reviews.author: David Epperson

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It's the perfect size for a Mossberg 590, with or without the added Magpul stock. Great for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: GreyScout

customer_reviews.title: Well made Cases
customer_reviews.text: This 42" case is for my Mossberg 590A1. I also have the 35" shorter version and both are very well made and durable cases.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Very good, but I wish it were just a little bigger
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with an S&W M&P 15-22. The rifle fits snugly, but you have to remove the magazine and the scope (Bushnell 1x28 red/green dot on quick release rings). The scope and magazine fit inside the case without difficulty. I might even be able to put in a second magazine. The external pockets are nice, but too small for a magazine. If the bag was slightly larger (wider) this would be a great AR bag. It's marketed as a shotgun bag, though, so one must cut it a little slack. Good zipper and build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Occupying Force

customer_reviews.title: Zipper is horrible
customer_reviews.text: Great case that has a lot of use however the zipper broke in less than six months and now has ZERO function...mind you once shotgun was secured it was removed TWICE to use and clean...horrible Company should replace for free
customer_reviews.author: AG22

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Mossberg 590A1 #51773.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Mossberg 590A1 #51773. Not much room for anything else. Pockets are designed for 10 extra shells. Not much room to store anything else. If you have a light mounted offset on the left/right, it starts needing a little force to close completely around. Wish it had two zippers and the zipper it comes with feels cheap.
customer_reviews.author: evh347

customer_reviews.title: Perfection and cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Well built gun case, perfectly totes around my Mossberg Field 88. I knew when I purchased that disassembling the barrel from the stock was pretty much required as I didn't want to carry around a nearly 50 inch bag. If you don't mind simply removing your barrel, then this is a great bag. Stores the gun rather well, with room for various accessories and a cleaning kit. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: T&CBondi

customer_reviews.title: The 42 inches case is not 42 inches, is 40 1/2 inches long. 7 1/2 width and 1 inch high
customer_reviews.text: I like it is nice, but you get what you pay. I didn’t like that I bought the 42 inches case and I mesure and find out is 40 1/2 inches case. You can put only your shotgun no more than that. 18 inche barrel. I bought it for my Remington 870 Tactical. No good if you have a pistol grip.
customer_reviews.author: M9

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Case...Best Price
customer_reviews.text: Best Price for a soft case. Got it for Tac-14 Remington. Same as a couple other soft cases i looked at for 3 times the money. Go ahead and get it without worrying.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Amy Missi

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Good quality- but you wouldn't be able to get a 35 inch gun in there. Mine is 32 inches and just fits. Light weight -so you wouldn't take it in the woods alot. No security rings for a lock- so you need a gun lock - for safety.
customer_reviews.author: home handy man

customer_reviews.title: Zipper was defective. Poor quality control.
customer_reviews.text: When tried to open it the zipper would not work. When closed it un zips and tough to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: The Glamper

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised and received several days ahead of schedule. Outstanding performance
customer_reviews.author: K.New

customer_reviews.title: Good price. Just not what I was wanting
customer_reviews.text: Product is exactly what is listed. Good price. Just not what I was wanting. Would like to have had more pictures to see before hand what I was buying. Still a good product and a excuse for my wife to go out and find something else to fit this bag.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 42" case for my Mossberg 500 20 gauge with an 18.5" barrel and a 4 shell side saddle. This case fits it perfectly. It is nicely padded so the weapon is well protected. The quality of materials and manufacture are very good. There are 2 relatively small pockets on the exterior which I believe is a plus because it prevents the case from becoming too bulky. This is a great basic case and an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: A. Reader

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a rifle.
customer_reviews.text: Good value for a rifle. It has some padding with two velcro pockets on the outside. The width may be a bit narrow for a shotgun with any accessories. There are elastic shell holders in each pocket. As mentioned by others, this is a single zipper bag. So no theft deterrent locking zippers here. I recommend this as a travel bag (not for airplanes) or as storage for a small rifle. Throw in a few desiccant bags and this should keep your hardware from corroding while stored.
customer_reviews.author: paititi

customer_reviews.title: Fine for Remington 870 folder
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my Remington 870 folding stock. The bag is easily long enough. Is probably an extra 6 to 8 in from left to right. Vertically, there's just enough room to fit the shotgun. I don't think you can go wrong for the money.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOTGUN CASE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made case and they have fast service.I could not be more satisfied. worth every penny!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Careful -- you may be sent the wrong product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and was charged for the 42" case... I received the 35", which does not fit my Remington 870 Tactical whatsoever. I'll be returning it. The case itself is nice -- it feels tough and well-constructed and the inside padding is decent. Two pockets, with slots to hold your shells. That said, I won't risk ordering from this buyer again and wasting more of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for what I need it for.  Keeping the dust off.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My Mossberg 500 with a flashlight hanging off the front of the barrel, and an adjustable stock with a pistol grip fits perfectly with the stock set at the 2nd longest setting. I haven't used the two side pouches yet. They have Velcro closures, and from my experience, Velcro doesn't last very long. It losses it's stickiness. Other than my concern with the Velcro, it is well built.
customer_reviews.author: Whit

customer_reviews.title: Serves it’s  purpose
customer_reviews.text: Good product but poor fit of you have a vertical foreword grip AND a holographic sight attached.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Nice case, not durable
customer_reviews.text: This case fit my shotgun great, and I was super proked at first, but after taking it out only two times, the zipper exploded, and there is no way to re thread the zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Franz Ruediger

customer_reviews.title: It sort of works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for my Remington 870 tactical. The gun is mostly for Tacti-Cool, and home defense purposes. Included on the rifle is a narrow choke that extends into a muzzle break. The shotgun also has a 2 shell extension. If it was not for these 2 additions (extension, and muzzle break) It would fit very snug. Right now the muzzle is sticking out along with an inch of the extended shell tube. It looks bad, but it covers most of the shotgun. The case would be closer to 33" also.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G

customer_reviews.title: Great for Mossberg home defense shotgun.
customer_reviews.text: Fit my Mossberg 500 retrograde shotgun perfectly. Great quality and good price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great case, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for my short barrel rifle application. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: mkpi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pistol grip 12 ga.
customer_reviews.text: Holds pistol grip 12 gauge with folding stock perfectly. Purchased inexpensive shoulder strap,on Amazon to make it a great carry case.
customer_reviews.author: AZME

customer_reviews.title: Nice soft interior
customer_reviews.text: Very soft interior. Durable exterior. Just squeeze in my Mossberg 590A1 with an ATI collapsible stock. Who can beat the price with this quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: Got what I paid for. Its a simple case. shotgun with tactile mods fits. But it doesn't offer that much protection
customer_reviews.author: Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I participate in Cowboy Mounted shooting so my shotgun is sawed off to a 21" barrel to make it lightweight. This case fit perfectly with a little extra room to put in some accessories such as my eye protection and ammo - which are black powder. And I love the two pockets on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Patti H.

customer_reviews.title: Works for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: No hold down straps but small enough the piece doesn’t move
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Sturdy and Decent Price
customer_reviews.text: Holds a Remington 870 with butt stock and has plenty of space for additional shells. Lightweight and compact design. There are 2 side pockets that have sleeves for up to 12 shells and space to drop more in
customer_reviews.author: darkwing duck

customer_reviews.title: Good bag
customer_reviews.text: Good bag. I use it to store my Maverick 88, with 18.5 inch barrel. Fits well. No bells or whistles, but it does the job and the price is right. Happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Best “case” scenario
customer_reviews.text: After much research, I went with the Bulldog case based on my application. Very pleased with quality, material and craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Sean S.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this case to hold a Mossberg Maverick 88 shotgun and the firearms fits perfectly with about an inch of space between the end of the barrel and the end of the stock. Have not used the case yet to transport the shotgun to the range, but it appears that it will be fine for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: George McCormack

customer_reviews.title: Nice case
customer_reviews.text: Very well made case. Roomy. I put a lever action in mine and fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Pike Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Needs dual zippers
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price, but the lacks a dual zipper, a big downfall, making it awkward to use. The manufacture should consider adding a second zipper, it would make this bag perfect for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: works great with my Mossberg maverick 88 also
customer_reviews.text: a little smaller than I initially thought it would be, but it does fit my Remington 770 with a Nikon prostaff on it, just barely even though its not meant for a rifle. works great with my Mossberg maverick 88 also.
customer_reviews.author: legallydeaf

customer_reviews.title: 870 tactical with flashlight fits perfect in 48".
customer_reviews.text: Perfect if it only had 2 zippers instead of 1. 870 tactical with Surefire light assembly fits great in a 48".
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Nice case
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the 42 inch case. Just fit my 40 inch tactical shotgun
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice case. Check measurements.
customer_reviews.text: Super (small) rifle case. Not a lot of frills but works great for SBR. Will not fit with scope and riser. I use a QD mount so not a problem. Price increased since purchasing, still recommend. Nice
customer_reviews.author: GWC

customer_reviews.title: Does its purpose! Great price!
customer_reviews.text: The bag will do its purpose. To transport my shotgun. Nothing fancy about the bag. It does have pockets to carry extra gear. And for value, I really didn't find anything better at this price range. Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Bag... Simplistic Functions!
customer_reviews.text: Quality bag for my 1301 Tactical. Plenty of room for ammo.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great case!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift, couldn’t have asked for a better fit! No issues, delivered on time.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren S.

customer_reviews.title: Great item.
customer_reviews.text: Good durable item with very good craftmanship with the sturdy, heavy duty zipper and sewing.
customer_reviews.author: Little B.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FIT
customer_reviews.text: A Tactical Shotgun Case that is a perfect fit and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold T. Serrata "Nolo Serrata"

customer_reviews.title: Won't accommodate the Boss 25
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my newly acquired Boss 25 Tactical 12 guage AR Style Shotgun. The case is not wide enough because of the Pistol Grip. It would be even worse if I had a Red Dot or other site mounted. I gave it a 3 because it isn't a bad case. I can still use it for another weapon. It was off by about 2-3 inches.
customer_reviews.author: D Ward

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Case
customer_reviews.text: Very well made case with good material and a quality zipper (so far). Excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Nunya

customer_reviews.title: The ruggedness if the bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Mossberg Shockwave and it was a prefect marriage
customer_reviews.author: CLB

customer_reviews.title: Great case for fed arm FRX 20ga pump
customer_reviews.text: Liked the fact gives a safe place to store my shotgun. Don't have any dislikes
customer_reviews.author: lee cain

customer_reviews.title: Check your size carefully
customer_reviews.text: The case I purchased said it was a 42 inch case. Not really 42 inches of useable space. It did appear well made and would have been perfect had the usable length been as described. I returned the case as my tactical shotgun wouldn’t fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: laurie

customer_reviews.title: good quality - well padded
customer_reviews.text: Good quality case. A little bit big for my shot gun but I ordered it that way so that I would have space for other things that go with it. Pockets to put about 12 rounds - not really enough for the range but works to keep them within reach if you need extra. well padded case.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: The case was very nicely built and nicely cushioned
customer_reviews.text: The case was very nicely built and nicely cushioned. I had my doubts fitting my Stevens shotgun since it had the pistol grip and buttstock, but it fit perfectly. I especially like the outside pockets which are perfect for more than a few shells. For the price, it is an extremely good value.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reycer

customer_reviews.title: I store all kinds of rifles and shotguns in these ...
customer_reviews.text: I store all kinds of rifles and shotguns in these. I got rid of the racks in the safe each gun gets it's own soft case to prevent damage.
customer_reviews.author: TwoHands

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable case
customer_reviews.text: This is my carrier for my work shotgun in my trunk
customer_reviews.author: Trev Clark

product_meta.title: Bulldog Cases Tactical Shotgun Case
feature_bullets: Fits most Pistol Grip & Tactical Shotguns. Case Measurements are external dimensions. For Best weapon fit, Deduct 2"
1 3/4" Total Soft Padding W/ Tricot Scratch Resistant Inner Lining
Full Length Heavy Duty Zipper & Zipper Pull
2 External Pockets W/ Hidden Elastic Shell Loops (Holds up to 12 Shells)

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
